titleInfo.title: USA v. Coons
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 10 Motion to Continue as to John R. Coons (1). The deadline for filing pretrial motions is extended to April 6, 2006. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 3/16/2006. (GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Coons
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER granting 13 Motion to Continue as to John R. Coons (1). Trial of this matter is continued to 9:00 a.m., May 22, 2006, for a duration of three days before the Honorable Richard G. Kopf. Jury selection will be held at commencement of trial. The time between April 3, 2006 and May 22, 2006 shall be deemed excludable time in any computation of time under the requirements of the Speedy Trial Act. 18 U.S.C. section 3161(h)(8)(A)&(B). Jury Trial set for 5/22/2006 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 4/3/2006. (GJG, )

Jury Trial set for 5/22/2006 09:00 AM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Signed by Magistrate Judge David L. Piester on 4/3/2006. (GJG, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Coons
titleInfo.subTitle: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant John R. Coons. It is ordered that: (1) I deny the objection (filing 24 part 1) and the motion (filing 24 part 2) for departure. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: TENTATIVE FINDINGS OF FACT regarding Presentence Investigation Report as to defendant John R. Coons. It is ordered that: (1) I deny the objection (filing 24 part 1) and the motion (filing 24 part 2) for departure. (2) Except to the extent (if at all) that I have reserved an issue for later resolution in the preceding paragraph, the parties are herewith notified that my tentative findings are that the presentence report is correct in all respects.ETC. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Coons
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant John R. Coons. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to tentative findings and request for evidentiary hearing 27 will be considered at an evidentiary hearing on Tuesday, September 12, 2006, at 1:00 p.m. for a period of one hour. (2) If it is true, the government should be prepared to prove the following statements contained at paragraphs 9 and 10 of the presentence report: Coons said that at one point, prior to [the] officers' arrival, he was scared enough that he got out his 9mm handgun and thought about using it to protect himself.... He again stated that he had considered using them to protect himself and that he had gotten one of the guns out earlier but then put it back.***Motion Hearing set for 9/12/2006 01:00 PM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: ORDER as to defendant John R. Coons. It is ordered that: (1) The defendant's objection to tentative findings and request for evidentiary hearing 27 will be considered at an evidentiary hearing on Tuesday, September 12, 2006, at 1:00 p.m. for a period of one hour. (2) If it is true, the government should be prepared to prove the following statements contained at paragraphs 9 and 10 of the presentence report: Coons said that at one point, prior to [the] officers' arrival, he was scared enough that he got out his 9mm handgun and thought about using it to protect himself.... He again stated that he had considered using them to protect himself and that he had gotten one of the guns out earlier but then put it back.***Motion Hearing set for 9/12/2006 01:00 PM in Courtroom 1 (Lincoln) before Judge Richard G. Kopf. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf.(KLL, )

titleInfo.title: USA v. Coons
titleInfo.subTitle: JUDGMENT as to John R. Coons. Defendant pleaded guilty to Count I of the Indictment and is hereby sentenced to probation for a term of three (3) years; $100 Special Assessment and a fine in the amount of $1000 as to defendant(s) John R. Coons. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. 1 Certified Copy to USM. (GJG, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
extension.docketText: JUDGMENT as to John R. Coons. titleInfo.title: USA v. Coons
titleInfo.subTitle: ORDER as to defendant John R. Coons. The defendant has filed a motion for release of seized property 39. The assistant for defense counsel has represented that counsel is informally resolving this issue. I have been patient as a result. However, we need to move this matter along. Therefore, IT IS ORDERED that the motion for release of seized property will be denied on Monday, February 25, 2008, unless counsel for the defendant arranges a telephone conference between himself, the prosecutor and the undersigned before that date. Counsel may contact my judicial assistant to arrange the conference. Ordered by Judge Richard G. Kopf. (KLL, )

extension.courtName: United States District Court District of Nebraska
